meanings.definition: Capable of being touched or felt.
meanings.sent1: The softness of the blanket added to its palpability.
meanings.sent2: The rough texture of the sandpaper made its palpability obvious.
meanings.sent3: The palpability of the marshmallow made it irresistible to the kids.
meanings.sent4: The palpability of the tension in the room could be cut with a knife.
meanings.sent5: The palpability of the excitement in the air was contagious.

meanings.sent1: The teacher's frustration was palpability evident in her tone.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were clear, ensuring the palpability of the task.
meanings.sent3: The palpability of the joke finally dawned on him, and he burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: The palpability of the truth in her words struck a chord with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The palpability of the danger ahead made them proceed with caution.

meanings.sent1: The palpability of the aroma from the bakery drew in customers.
meanings.sent2: The palpability of the music in the room set a lively atmosphere.
meanings.sent3: The palpability of the mistake was evident in his sheepish expression.
meanings.sent4: The palpability of the tension between them was thick enough to cut with a knife.
meanings.sent5: The palpability of the joy in her smile was infectious to everyone around.
